quizzes.question: What tag should be used to add an image?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]The Tag[/h1] The [b][/b] tag is used to insert an image. It contains only attributes, and does not have a closing tag. The image's URL (address) can be defined using the [b]src [/b]attribute. The HTML image syntax looks like this: [code format="html"][b][/b][/code]

quizzes.question: What attribute should be used to add an image URL?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Image Location[/h1] You need to put in the [b]image location[/b] for the src attribute that is between the quotation marks. For example, if you have a photo named "tree.jpg" in the same folder as the HTML file, your code should look like this: [code format="html" codeId="20"] first page [b][/b] [/code] [note]In case the image cannot be displayed, the alt attribute specifies an alternate text that describes the image in words. The alt attribute is [b]required[/b].[/note]

quizzes.question: What two attributes can be used to resize images inside HTML code?
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Image Resizing [/h1] To define the image size, use the width and height attributes. The value can be specified in [b]pixels [/b]or as a [b]percentage:[/b] [code format="html" codeId="21"] first page [/code] [note]Loading images takes time. Using large images can slow down your page, so use them with care.[/note]

quizzes.question: Fill in the blank:
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Image Border [/h1] By default, an image has no borders. Use the border attribute within the image tag to create a border around the image. [code format="html" codeId="22"] [/code] [note]By default, Internet Explorer 9, and its earlier versions, display a border around an image unless a border attribute is defined.[/note]
